docs.lead_paragraph: The arts, and the benefits to the public they provide, sometimes gets lost, barely noticed by government. Fractured Atlas, a New York City-based multi-disciplinary arts service organization, is finding that by creating information and data services for its members among the city's arts communities, it can also provide more effective advocacy for the arts to government.

headline.main: NYT Districts API helps Fractured Atlas help artists

docs.abstract: The arts, and the benefits to the public they provide, sometimes gets lost, barely noticed by government. Fractured Atlas, a New York City-based multi-disciplinary arts service organization, is finding that by creating information and data services for its members and for city arts communities, it can also provide more effective advocacy for the arts to government. Fractured Atlas uses the New York Times' District API to create and run these services and to link them to its arts advocacy mission.
docs.snippet: The arts, and the benefits to the public they provide, sometimes gets lost, barely noticed by government. Fractured Atlas, a New York City-based multi-disciplinary arts service organization, is finding that by creating information and data services...

headline.main: Romney Firing Remarks Draw Criticism From Huntsman

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney joked about dismissing people as he comes under scrutiny for job losses connected to his time at a private equity firm.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney joked about dismissing people as he comes under scrutiny for job losses connected to his time at a private equity firm.

docs.lead_paragraph: 12:27 p.m. | Updated NASHUA, N.H. - Mitt Romney began an address to the Nashua Chamber of Commerce here on Monday by talking about how he started his consulting career "at the entry level," and wound down his speech talking about the need to be "able to fire" people or businesses when they provide bad service.

headline.main: Perry Joins Rivals in Attacking Romney on Bain

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney's Bain Capital "looted" a company in Gaffney, S.C., and got "rich off failures and sticking it to someone else," Gov. Rick Perry of Texas charged this morning as he began a swing through South Carolina.

headline.main: Same-Sex Marriage a Priority for Democrats in Trenton
headline.print_headline: Same-Sex Marriage a Priority for Democrats in Trenton

docs.abstract: Democratic leaders in New Jersey are planning to make a bill allowing same-sex marriage the centerpiece of their agenda in 2012, reflecting key change from 2010 when similar legislation failed to pass because some state senators did not vote on issue.
docs.snippet: In 2010, the Senate defeated such a bill, and if it passes this year, Gov. Chris Christie is expected to veto it.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

docs.lead_paragraph: In the last six months, six people have been killed in pharmacy holdups on Long Island, and some druggists fear going to work.

headline.seo: Anxious Days for Long Island Pharmacies
headline.main: Behind the Counter, an Acute Anxiety
headline.print_headline: Behind the Counter, an Acute Anxiety

docs.abstract: Long Island pharmacists are experiencing anxiety over rash of armed robberies in area drug stores, two of which resulted in six deaths.
docs.snippet: In the last six months, six people have been killed in pharmacy holdups on Long Island, and some druggists fear going to work.

docs.lead_paragraph: The push toward operations like Lap-Band surgery on the young has brought some resistance from doctors who say it is too drastic on patients whose bodies might still be developing.

headline.seo: Young, Obese and Getting Weight-Loss Surgery

docs.abstract: Along with the obesity epidemic in America has come an explosion in weight-loss surgery, most recently among young people; push toward surgery on the young has brought some resistance from doctors who say it is too drastic to operate on patients whose bodies might still be developing (Series: The Big Picture).
docs.snippet: The push toward operations like Lap-Band surgery on the young has brought some resistance from doctors who say it is too drastic on patients whose bodies might still be developing.

docs.lead_paragraph: Caterpillar is one of dozens of companies, many with growing profits and large cash reserves, that have come to expect states to pay for training for factory workers in return for creating jobs.

headline.seo: States Pay to Train Workers, to Companies’ Benefit
headline.main: Private Sector Gets Job Skills; Public Gets Bill
headline.print_headline: Private Sector Gets Job Skills; Public Gets Bill

docs.abstract: Dozens of companies, many with growing profits and large cash reserves, have come to expect states to pay for training their workers in return for creating jobs; although the sums spent on training are usually small compared with the tax breaks and other credits doled out by states, some critics are questioning the tactic now that the labor market is showing some signs of improvement.
docs.snippet: Caterpillar is one of dozens of companies, many with growing profits and large cash reserves, that have come to expect states to pay for training for factory workers in return for creating jobs.
